properties.areaDesc: Bedford, PA; Fulton, PA; Somerset, PA; Franklin, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 7:07AM EST until January 8 at 7:30AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Central Bedford County in south central Pennsylvania...
Central Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania...
Northeastern Somerset County in south central Pennsylvania...
Northeastern Fulton County in south central Pennsylvania...

* Until 730 AM EST.

* At 707 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from Fort Littleton to Everett to near Paint, moving east
at 45 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind
gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions.

* This includes the following Interstates...
Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 148.
The Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 162 and 183...and
from mile markers 187 to 188.
Interstate 99 from mile markers 1 to 9.

Locations impacted include...
Windber, Breezewood, New Enterprise, Everett, Osterburg,
Harrisonville, Davidsville, Waterfall, Wells Tannery, Fort Littleton,
St. Clairsville, Valley-Hi, Saluvia, Cessna, Ogletown, Upper
Strasburg, Sideling Hill Rest Area, Fannettsburg, Orrstown and
Defiance.
properties.instruction:
Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 7:30 AM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
